Reviews.Title: “Trip with Friends”
Reviews.Author: ndesplat
Reviews.Content: Good value for a group of 3. We had 3 single beds and paid a very reasonable rate. It was clean and in a safe area. We walked most places from here, but also conveniently took the subway as well. They provide shampoo but no conditioner, so bring that. There are also safes in the room, but are opened by the key, so not sure how effective that makes it.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic. Area not very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Belllo
Reviews.Content: THis hotel was booked as an xmas present from family. We enjoyed our trip to Barcelona but found this hotel very basic and in a bit of a rough area of town, lots of muggings took place when we were there and there were some dodgy characters about. We were fine though luckily, prob cos my husband is a huge fella. Hotel was clean enough. Was 15-20 min walk to Rambles. Barcelona is nice and we did enjoy our visit but would book nearer to the centre ourselves next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: laurahoo84
Reviews.Content: Ronda Hotel is good value for your money. This was one of the cheapest hotels in Barcelona with this good location. Hotel itself is small and quite old, but if you are just looking for a place to sleep, it's perfectly fine. Room is roomy enough and bathroom was nice and big. We had some problems with the room though: walls are thin and you can hear everything your neighbors say. There's some water pipes inside the walls and they make a lot of noise, not a nice thing especially in the middle of the night! Another warning: If your room mate leaves the room and you lie in bed not moving, electricity shuts down automatically. This happened to us when my boyfriend went outside for smoking and I stayed in our room alone. I was lying in bed and watching tv, not moving a lot, and suddenly the lights went off and tv shut down itself. The whole room was dark, it was quite scary... When I stood up, electricity came back on. There's a small motion detector on the wall which turns power back on, and there's some sort of automatic power switcher that turns the electricity off when you leave the room... Location is good, although the neighborhood is little bit restless. Not a long walking distance to the nearest metro station. Nice cafe opposite the hotel, much better breakfast there than in the hotel. Staff is nice, but all of them don't speak English very well, could be a problem if you don't speak Spanish... Not sure would I go back but this wasn't the worst hotel I've been to (and not the best either...)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: lonestar1988
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days with my boyfriend and we had a very nice time. The staff was nice, the room was clean and very big, especially for a european city! The hotel is located close to the Place de Catalogne and publoc transport - it may seem like it isn't central, but it is!

Reviews.Title: “Think twice”
Reviews.Author: Traveller996
Reviews.Content: Good location, but very noisy at night, staff not very helpful, rooms ok but not to many windows in rooms, got sick from the air-conditioning. Restaurant food not good. Ok for short stay but no longer than 2. Be careful of there air-conditioning I don't think they clean there filters. Shop around is the best advice

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL, VERY SCARY, VERY DISHONEST, VERY DIRTY”
Reviews.Author: Amanda S
Reviews.Content: My friend and I chose this hotel at the last minute. We will never forget our horrible experience... we booked online, when we showed up the room wasn't ready, they told us the cost of the room would be more than what we agreed to online, and the wifi wasn't working. When we finally got to our room, it was nasty and we were supposed to stay at the hotel for 4 days. The first 2 days we didn't have any hot water, not even warm. We complained to the staff who said they would not move us to a new room AND we would have to wait a day for the maintenance person to come fix the problem. We asked to be compensated since we could not take showers nor could we cancel the reservation since it was made online. The staff was horrible, they refused to let us speak to a manager saying, "No one is allowed to talk to the manager." They would call him on the phone while we stood there in front of them. It was humiliating. One night, a few guys got stuck on the elevator, which was jerking up and down with the doors partially opened, and they were screaming for help (it was over 100 degrees in the elevator, in the middle of summer). My friend and I frantically ran down the many flights of stairs to the front desk to get help. The staff stared blankly at us and could care less!!!!! Finally, a staff member got the guys out, but it was all very scary. Later, the guys told us lots of things were stolen from their room. We were so disgusted with everything at Hotel Ronda, we left a day early to relocate at a new hotel, losing over 200 Euros for leaving a day early. We were told be locals that this place is run by the mafia. I wouldn't be surprised if it was, as I have never experienced such disgraceful customer service in my life. We didn't feel safe or welcomed at this hotel. It was disgusting in every way possible.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the photos”
Reviews.Author: HAStewart
Reviews.Content: Our room looked NOTHING like the rooms in the photographs! Our very small window looked into the lift shaft!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Delhi, in, National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
Reviews.Title: “Cheap last minute hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrippieDvisor
Reviews.Content: the hotel is tucked away in a by lane of a busy street. the first evening the location didnt seem too safe and it felt like a ghetto however nothing funny happened and the stay was a plesent one. the rooms were adequate size for what we paid in an expensive city like barcelona. didnt bother with the breakfast there was wifi availebale for a charge.

Reviews.Title: “This is possibly the worst hotel I have ever been to...”
Reviews.Author: snowbunny783
Reviews.Content: "Hotel" Ronda was absolutely disgusting. It might as well be called HOSTEL RONDA. I booked it through the internet and unfortunately when I arrived it was nothing like it was advertised. The parking below was a joke, the staff I spoke to which was ABEGAIL PAPIO and DEICHEL ADAJAN were extremely unfriendly and unhelpful. I walked into my room and literally left 5 minutes after. I told the staff I couldn't stay here as the hotel was nothing like it was advertised, the rooms were dirty and it was extremely loud. Even though I had only been there for 5 minutes the staff refused to refund my 2 nights stay and also refused to refund my 2 day parking. I asked for the manager and they said he would was not there and wouldn't come to the hotel to speak to me. I'm not worried of course as I paid with American Express and the "Hotel" Ronda won't be getting a Euro. I strongly suggest that anyone who wishes to stay in Barcelona should stay somewhere else. We chose The Pullman which was amazing!! Good luck!!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money hotel in a very central location.”
Reviews.Author: kerberBelfast
Reviews.Content: i stayed here recently for 4 nights with my husband and had a really enjoyable time. the location was great, only minutes walk to la ramblas, where we were then able to access the bus tours etc.. the hotel is right beside antonio metro stop which was also great for getting arround. the hotel was basic, but extremely clean, the maids came in every day to change the bed, towels etc...was disappointed that there were no tea/coffee making facilities though. the breakfast was great value for 8 euros, all you could eat & more, it set us up for the day. we also had our dinner in the hotel on our first night and this too was very tasty and reasonably priced. however, the restaurant was disappointingly quiet and it was for this reason that we decided to dine elsewhere for the remainder of our stay. the barstaff wern't overly friendly and didn't seem to care if we stayed or went, so we needless to say, went. we would definately stay here again for handyness sake. was also only 20 euros from the airport so pointless trying to work out what trains/buses etc you need.

Reviews.Title: “Horrivel....horrible, health hazard”
Reviews.Author: nmra1976
Reviews.Content: We reserve two night in the Hotel Ronda in Barcelona, however we were not capable to be housed in the Hotel more than 4 hours. Very bad the hygiene state, with risk of greets publishes for any customer. Attendance and shelter in the reception are very bad. Responsible one does not exist no that it is available to hear the customer. we efectuamos Claim to the Catalunia Government. Booking must immediately cancel the publication of this Hotel. It does not deserve to be in the Booking. More hygienical to be in the street that to sleep in the Hotel Ronda.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed in my room, hotel staff denied theft...not the first time here”
Reviews.Author: MB600
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in Feb 2011. On the last day of the conference, the house maids went into my room at 6:30PM and stole 700 euros from my wallet, placing the empty wallet back into my bag so I wouldn't know it was tampered with. When I confronted the hotel, they denied my claim and refused to believe the theft. This hotel has a serious theft issue and I would not recommend staying here. The hotel was very noisy, especially at night where I had to wear earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you want to relax and tour around”
Reviews.Author: flacatops
Reviews.Content: Tha Hotel is close to eveything, but not close enough to have a bad sleep because of the steet noise. a 5 min walk to metro Universitat and a 1 min walk to Gran Via , you can also walk to Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya with no problems. Tha hotel room is smaller than it looks in the hotel's photos (a lot smaller) but it's ok. Bathroom is big anough and there is hot water always. There was an unconfortable situation with the sink but we didnt pass much time there and we didnt complain, water didnt go down easily so the sink lookd dirty with makeuo or tooth paste residues. Tha service was good and polite. In conclusion I recomend this hotel if you want to be fine and dont pay so much fir being close to touristic places in BCN city. Ohh I forgot, the tween beds are too small and light weight if you move a lil hard the bed moves too.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe anything bad people are writing here.. its all lies. i pity those people! it was awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: siemprebarcaxx
Reviews.Content: Amazing. amazing. amazing. this is all i have to say. location is great, rooms are incredibly clean, service is outstanding. loved the receptionists! they were a huge help! wish i could thank them again for everything!! they speak near native level english!! even though you dont get to see that quality in a lot of people there.. which is a pity. communication was great. everything was great! loved every second of it. To sum up.. it was phenomenal. would most definately go and stay there again! highly recommended!! Peace

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Volga981
Reviews.Content: I must say that this is a nice budget hotel. I stayed there for one night (early flight, and my gf left one day before). The price is small compared with neighboring hotels, and the service corresponds to the price. The concierge was very professional and quick with perfect command of English, I did receive a good welcome. Additional materials about the city that I received at the check-in (brochure, map, tours, biking, etc.) were very convenient. The location is good for the price, just keep in mind that there is a reasonable (10 min) walk to La Rambla. Two problems I have noticed. At 5AM there still were some people outside, and I could hear them perfectly with closed windows. However, my windows faced the square. Also, if you need everything to be perfectly clean, Ronda is probably not your best choice. I found it good for the price I paid, but some might dislike water/soap streaks on the bathtub glass. Otherwise this is a good hotel. Hotel has reasonbly priced WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Pity about the Bad Reviews”
Reviews.Author: sootee6
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I have just returned from a five day trip to Barcelona staying at the Ronda Hotel. We had read the reviews beforehand and would like to address the negative ones. We found the staff extremely helpful and polite. The room was basic but very clean as was the bathroom. We ate out all of the time so cannot comment on the food. The hotel is well situated close to the shops, metro and covered market. La Rambla is easily within walking distance. The cafe Brasil close to the hotel do good snacks and lovely coffee. We didn't think their prices were too bad and the staff were great. We went on a bus tour which was excellent value. We asked for information at the reception and got a small discount on the ticket price through them. All in all we had a great break. We didn't feel particularly threatened wherever we went but we weren't out very late and we think care needs to be taken in any big city.

Reviews.Title: “Worse stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: JakobKrag
Reviews.Content: I have nothing positive to write about this hotel. When my friends and I arrived to the hotel for 1,5 hours, then our money was gone when we got back. It was about 600 euros. Our door was locked and no sign of damage on the door. The maids are stealing! No help in the reception, because "it's impossible, you are the only one who has a key". Only one key for the rooms? Yeah, right. The last night my friend and I were mugged 30 seconds away from the hotel. I had to buy wireless internet, so i could cancel my credit card. What a service! The hotel is also in the middle of the slum. People are doing drugs, and selling narcotics outside the hotel. DON'T EVER VISIT HOTEL RONDA!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all the comments here”
Reviews.Author: VIM48
Reviews.Content: As the last post said I wasn't expecting a very good experience with this hotel but was very pleasantly surprised. The staff on reception were very helpful and friendly. The room was fairly basic but clean and had everything you need. The hotel is placed between 2 metro stations so very convenient. We didn't eat in the hotel but there are quite a lot of places nearby. I agree though not to use the cafe Brasil just outside. Not such good value as other places.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for price, in quite a funky area!”
Reviews.Author: iTrailBlazer
Reviews.Content: Ok if you read the other reviews and think this is going to be hel then think again. I have stayed in 5 star hotels and also in hostels around the world so i think i have a fair assessment of lodgings. The hotel is clean, tidy, relatively modern and has welcoming staff. I stayed for 6 days including a weekend and the staff were welcoming and also quite honest about Barcelona and the area in general. The area is funky and the side roads either side are well lit with some interesting little pubs and bars. Would i go down them at 2am on my own, probably not, but them i wouldnt walk down a side street at 2am in most cities! Any way there is mostly students down there and its all great fun. The hotel was acceptabe though the air con was aimed at the wall and then came down the wall onto my bed which was a little cold so i mved the bed two feet every night. All in all food was ok, though i would reccomend eating out rather then in as there are so many places nearby. The cafe on the square outside is busy in the mornings and the wait to eat is not worth it, find somewhere else. At night it is true that there are some sulubrious goings on in the square but nothing to sinister and its all good fun when walking through. We had a laugh and a joke with them as did everyone that walked passed. I you feel threatened by this then dont stay here. Hope this helps, id stay here again.!

Reviews.Title: “Close Ronda hotel, the ugly face of the great BARCELONA”
Reviews.Author: Kinghussein
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel; myself, my old Mum and my brother through " Vueling air ". I think they have their agreement with booking.com. Dirty hotel. no water, no electricity and necessary to tell you about the Asian receptionist!!! Gorgot to tell you about roads lead to the hotel; full of upnormal pepole where you feel unsafe all the time. They charged us a gull refund for 01 night we did not stay while they asked us to turn away to another hotel as the 18th century hotel has no water or no electricity. Please review all the comments from honest pepole sent to " trip advisor "!!! Keep away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Fatcatmark
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel without reading the reviews so was fearing the worst when we arrived at this hotel. Both myself and my wife loved the location and its proximity to Las Ramblas and the port area. We walked around the streets a lot and never felt uncomfortable or threatened wherever we went. There are 2 metro stations within strolling distance and a great little cafe next door to the hotel where we had breakfast every day. Yes you need to keep your wits about you as you would in any major city but I have to say we had an amazing time. The hotel is a bit basic and we didn't venture into the restaurant so we can't comment on that but the rooms were clean and had what we expected for the price. A fridge and free Wifi would have been nice and I thought it was a little bit mean to have to hire the room safe (which we didn't on principle) but all in all we feel we got value for money

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel - dicey area”
Reviews.Author: maneatshouse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Ronda on business and paid 200 euros per night. However, that's only because there was a major conference in town and so accommodation was limited in Barcelona. At any other time, I wouldn't pay much more than 50-75 euros for this hotel. The reviews so far nicely sum up the hotel. It's very basic, customer service is mixed (mostly weak), the rooms were small, no breakfest, facilities are poor but the real concern is the area. Looking on a map, it looks nicely placed near Las Ramblas and other sites. However, when you arrive it's surrounded by dark alleys and feels quite dangerous. At night, a couple of bars are open but most shops are shut giving it a quiet feel. I wasn't pleased to see other reviews that the front door was locked at night. On each night, I found that it was locked but that someone was sat at the front desk and could let me in straight away. There are some good points. It's cheap (normally) and the shower was both hot and powerful. Overall though, I wouldn't recommend staying here. If you've booked already, I wouldn't overly fret - just keep your wits about you and get a taxi back each night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rhonda good value for menoey in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: goglasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room for 75 Euros per night which was reasonable value for money in Barcelona. The room was spotless and hotel staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a brisk 5 minute walk from the Metro (Universitat). Two streets away from the Museum of Contemporary Art and 10 minutes walk from the Ramblas. We did not encounter any difficulties while there however it was not the most welcoming of areas and we did feel that we had to be on our guard, particularly in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ronda not Rondda”
Reviews.Author: Welshman76
Reviews.Content: It was a 40th Birthday weekend spent by 7 chaps in Barcelona. The hotel wasn't too bad but the area was very suspect. First night 3 of our party were mugged and picked pocketed within 200 yards of the hotel. All 3 had been dropped off by a taxi and set upon by numerous Spanish thugs.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!!”
Reviews.Author: SinedVincennes
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel on lastminutes.com , my mistake was, not to check tripadvisor report. The hotel is like a one star hotel , room was not clean , water was leaking in the bathroom., furnitures have been there probably since the hotel opened 50 years agao . Avoid this hotel at any cost!!

Reviews.Title: “It worked for us...................”
Reviews.Author: Redtoucan
Reviews.Content: OK so you can read all the storys of the muggers etc but of course you can get that in any city. We were a group of 8 staying at the hotel so obviously not an easy target but whilst it is in an unglamourous area you can see that the locals are trying hard to improve it. They are building a new undercover market near the hotel and whilst staying there we had no problems getting taxis back to the hotel. I would agree its not a place for a romantic weekend away but for groups of 4 or more then its fine, just stay together and be vigilent when out at night. In the day its fine. Oh and for breakfast go to the Bracafe in the piaza outside, it must be good as the local police were always in there having food and drink!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: Nina_London_Nina
Reviews.Content: PLEASE read this the other reviews and trust that this is not a safe place! The hotel is a 15min walk from the La Ramblas and its very unsafe for any tourist. After a night out we were attacked outside the hotel as we walked from the cab to the main doors. After wrestling 2 men and being kicked to the ground, we managed to run into the hotel with all our belongings with us...along with bruises and scuffs. The main doors are transparent glass doors and the receptionist watched the whole attack and didnt even ask if we were ok...THANKS! Also, we had trouble getting a cab on one night as a couple of the drivers refused to take us to the hotel. Makes you wonder why. We had read the previous reviews on here about a mugging before we left for barcelona but stupidly ignored it as we thought it was a one off situation and that it could happen to anyone. Little did we know that it is so normal that the receptionist turns a blind eye. In addition, the hotel is nothing more than a hostel.....not worth the price even it is a bargain. Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel, What Is The Fuss”
Reviews.Author: paulliz
Reviews.Content: We wanted to go to Barcelona on a weekend break after finding cheap flights with Ryan Air! As we were on a tight budget, we were looking for a reasonable hotel, near the sights and most of all it needed to be cheap! Hotel Ronda fulfiled all of these requirements and therefore (with some reservation) we booked for three nights at £150. After reading the reviews here we were a bit put of so were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Although the hotel lies in a slightly rough arera of town we were pleased with the size and cleanliness of our room. The hotel is close to the University and has lots of quirky shops and bars close by. Only a few mins walk for the Gothic Quater and Las Ramblas. There is also a Metro station only a few seconds walk for the hotel. So all in all a great base. Of course not a luxury hotel but this served as a great place from which to explore beautiful Barcelona! Good value for money! Remember "you get what you pay for".......

Reviews.Title: “Ronda Hotel Barcelona is a great deal for visiting a city”
Reviews.Author: robert011
Reviews.Content: Ronda Hotel Barcelona room number 305 It is really a great deal. I can´t understand what others expect from a 3 star hotel, because some visitors wrote bad critics of this hotel. Perhaps they had another room or they expect more than the price could offer. The hotel is situated near the center, 10 minutes to walk to the ramblas, 3 minutes go walk to the next metro station, surrounded by coffe shops. What else do you need for visiting a city? The reception was opened for 24 hours, very helpfull and friendly of corse english speaking. I booked by one RatesToGo.com but it would be a little cheaper to book it directly. They have rooms with double bed and french beds. Just tell them, what you prefer. If you book by RatesToGo, your credit card is only charged for about 20% of the rate. If you book directly it would be charged for the full rate. When you arrive you have to pay for the whole. I payed € 56 for a double per day without breakfast. The breakfast is a buffet for about € 10. I didn´t need it, because dinnertime in spain starts after 9 pm. What to do with a buffet in the morning? Allthough it looked good. my room? I had everything I needed. Two clean beds, safe to rent, Tv with international channels (in german only 3 sat) clean bathroom with toilet, bidet and bathtube. Every day fresh towels. Hairdryer - soap and shampoo renewed every day. At our arrival, a lamp was not working, but it was renewed after some minutes. I had a room looking not to the street. Perhaps this is the reason why we didn´t have any noise of the street. Somethimes I heared the elevator, when the wondow was opened. They have also climatronic or heating, but I didn´t use it in november. I was very lucky with this hotel. It is a great deal for this money and a great deal to visit barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING! DO NOT STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: Janetmci
Reviews.Content: The first night we returned to the hotel after dinner to find the doors locked and no-one at reception, despite 24 hour reception service advertised on website. We banged on the doors but no answer. A man then attacked us, stole our phones, bank cards etc. Screamed for help, some time later the receptionist finally appeared and doors opened. She claims she was up checking rooms. We pointed out that this is not 24 hour reception service, she was on the defensive - despite us being distraught by the event she offered us no help, no concern for our wellbeing. We informed her we wouldn't be staying any longer - were checking out the following morning. Asked for refund when we were checking out the following morning - the receptionist absolutely refused, and then presented us with a phone bill for 70Euro for the emergency calls made home from reception to cancel phones/bank cards. They ended up calling police because we said we weren't happy paying it until a refund on our rooms was sorted! Booked an early flight home, stayed at nicer safer hotel the next two nights (Hotel Jazz - definitely reccommend it). Awful trip, terrible service, disaster of a hotel - DO NOT GO THERE. Really really unsafe area. Two dark alleys on either side of the hotel - perfect get aways for thieves.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: logictraveller
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Ronda and was met by a very rude receptionist. We felt like we were her last priority between current guests, phone conversations and everything else. Our room reeked of sewer, and we could hear the elevator every time it moved. The bathroom was full of mold and very cramped. I talked to the receptionist 10 minutes after checking in and she was very defensive. She said I could look at another room. It was the same room, one story below, and it smelled even worse (this was their only other available room). I kindly asked for a refund so that we could go somewhere else, but she refused (saying that she had talked to the manager about it, who was not working that Sunday). We decided to rough it out, and stayed there for the two nights. I also talked to hotels.com, and they contacted the hotel but the manager at the hotel was not willing to give a refund. Location is OK, but not the greatest. It's on a busy street with lots of sirens throughout the night. The standard of this hotel is very close to that of a hostel. Do yourself a huge favor and stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars? More like Brown Star.”
Reviews.Author: spongebobnopants
Reviews.Content: Location - terrible, right in the centre of a seedy rough neighbourhood. Room - terrible, tiny, cramped, beds about 4 inches off the floor, bathroom full of mould, automatic shutters on windows add to the "prison cell" feel. For some reason you are not provided with a remote control for the TV unless you ask for one at reception. All night long you will hear random conversations, shouting, doors slamming, running in the corridors, etc. This hotel is the most excellent conductor of sound I have experienced. This hotels status as a 3 star makes a mockery of the ratings system on the continent. A 1 star rating would be more than this dump deserves. Awful, awful hotel, which by the way was booked through the Barcelona tourist information office which I find amazing. Of all the hotels available in the city why does the tourist office choose to send visitors to a kip in a rough area of town? Nonsensical. Avoid at all costs, as it will only ruin your stay in what is otherwise a beautiful city

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: UnfussyTraveller
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute (directly, as it was cheaper) for its price and location. The receptionists werent particularly friendly, but the room was clean and air conditioned and the location had "character". Though it did feel unsafe at times, there were plenty of people about until the early hours of the morning (we were there during the Aug peak season). I would definitely come here again at that price (or less).

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected.”
Reviews.Author: kht1468
Reviews.Content: I had previously booked a hotel in the Gothic area for a one night stay, and our dates changed, so I had to ring Expedia to select another hotel and cancel the other one. I booked this one solely on price, as we'd managed to get a 76E deal on the other hotel, but this one was 80E, and we didn't really want to pay any more. Once it was then booked I then read the reviews and was very worried, as they didn't rate it well. So I was surprised when we arrived, with the help of our Tomtom on our motorbike. Firstly they have parking, at the cost of 18 euros a night, which for the city centre isn't bad, but we parked our bike around the corner, in a little plaza, which was perfectly safe and not tampered with. The room was very clean and quite quirky - with a slightly slanted ceiling. The twin beds were large ( we tend to usually go for twin beds now as doubles in hotels are sometimes really small!). The bath was the small spanish variety, but a little hard to get into if you have problems stepping in and out as it backed onto the toilet - but I expect they would have let us change rooms if this had been an issue. The area itself wasn't the best in the world, but I did know this when I booked it. But it is only a 5 minute walk to the Ramblas, and if you go straight across to it, rathe than down and aross then you avoid the smellier areas - only one street we went down smelt like a toilet. All in all it wasn't as bad as I expected from other reviews....I would stay there again, I have stayed in better locations but for us the price was right that night.

Reviews.Title: “Give this place a chance!”
Reviews.Author: MartinTsa
Reviews.Content: Hmmm, to say I was a little petrified about staying here given the previous discomfiting reviews is to put it mildly to say the least. We got a verrry cheap deal through Lastminute for a 3 night breack with BA flights where, if you consider each leg of the journey cost £100 each we essentially got the hotel for free. Seeing as there was no such thing as a free meal, I was expecting a dirty hell hole and very rude staff and can happily report I was proven wrong. The staff was curteous and gave us maps of the area upon check in. We took the stairs to room 110 and found it to have adequate space and was spotlessly clean. Toiletries, fluffy towels (changed every day), even combs were provided. If you want extra, such as the safe or a remote control for the tv, these can be hired. The airconditioning worked well and the beds were fine. You could hear the toilet being flushed in the room above, but only in the bathroom and we had some noisy Czechs in the room adjacent to us so this hotel, as any others can be noisy at times. Bring earplugs or sleeping pills if this bothers you. As noted in other reviews, the hotel is very well placed. Head up the road to Universitat, a short stroll with many good places to eat, a bit further in the same direction is Eixample, the gay district. To the east is La Rambla, you come emerge onto it about a third the way down which is fine. For those that are planning their first trip, try getting the train from the airport rather than a taxi. At the airport buy from the ticket machines a "T10" for zone 1 costing approx €7 (this is pretty much all of Barcelona that you would possibly need!) the T10 is a carnet of 10 single trips which can be used on the trains, metro, buses. Get on either train departing from the airport - they both go to the center. Change at Passeig de Gracia, a stop after Sants, and hop onto the metro to Sant Antoni stop. You will then be about a 4 minute walk from the hotel and the entire journey would have cost you about €1.40. Bargain! Also, I didn't try the hotel €10 bargain as there are many many coffee shops on Carrer Sant Antoni where you can get a croissant or sandwich and a coffee for about €3. Enjoy Barcelona, it's a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Canny”
Reviews.Author: Garry24
Reviews.Content: I thought this was place was canny enough, clean, staff were friendly and a handy enough walk from Place de Catalunya and La Rambla. Stay to the main drag which is easily navigable if you're easily spooked as some of the back streets are a little ropey but in saying that we experienced nothing too daunting. The room itself was basic but clean and fairly quiet, we were on the 5th floor and the only noise we had was related to toilet activity from next door and above. We must have timed our visit along with the national pop drinking competitions as there were some champion efforts in the wee hours!!! I would recommend this, not for romantic weekends but alright if you're looking for a room where you'll spend little time but want good value for money. I found the staff spot on, it appeared a lot of the staff were Philipino and they were grand at all times. Breakfast for 10 euros. We had this on a couple of mornings in the same way an army going on a yomp would have porridge. It may not be a culinary delight but it does it's job!

Reviews.Title: “Nice no-frills hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: nexanimal
Reviews.Content: Central location, walk two blocks to University Metro stop and you can go just about anywhere. Just off of a busy street, but tucked back onto a quiet side street. Some reviewers complained of noise -- ask for an upper room toward the back of the hotel if you're a light sleeper. Our 6th floor room was quiet as a church. 24 hour front desk support. Wireless internet for a very reasonable fee. Clean room, comfortable beds. Requested change of sheets after 3 days, else housekeeping was superb. Didn't try the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rwanda Indeed”
Reviews.Author: thisdeservesaletter
Reviews.Content: This 'hotel' is quite possibly the most terrible I have ever stayed in. Unfortunately we were in Barcelona during an international mobile phone conference which left us with little choice according to our budget. We paid 90 euro p.n. (without breakfast) and as this is classed a 3 star hotel, I assumed it would be ok. It most certainly was not. We were given room 306 which must be the noisiest in the hotel - terrible. Beds were foam and even thought you may request a non-smoking room don't count on it. Bathroom was mouldy and room was damn hot - even in the middle of winter. There was no bar fridge nor glasses. To top it all off, we had to pay a 20 euro deposit for the TV remote control. When I questioned this the receptionist told me this was normal. I thought this must be some sort of spanish tradition - we are now staying in a lovely 3 star hotel in Girona and I can assure you this is not the practice of all spansih hospitality institutions. This is the first review I have written as I feel that others need to be warned. DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS DESPERATE. The only compliment I can offer is that the receptionists spoke English and we were allowed to check in early , a small blessing.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL RWANDA!!!”
Reviews.Author: mugseybear
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in july 07. ok lets begin with its Location:: this hotels location was pretty good in regards distance to las ramblas with a ten to fifteen minute walk. HOWEVER the square adjacent to the hotel was a gathering point for the "LOCALS" who seem to use the STREET as a public toilet facility!!!!!! on the upside to this location there was a SPAR around the corner which was open 24 hours which was always a good thing. now lets turn to the ROOM!! it was very basic- bed bathroom and shower and smal table with small mirror.bathroom steamed up that much after a shower, i nearly lost my friend in it a couple of times.a tip for the hotel would be to install a fan!! room didnt feel very secure as there was no lock on the door and anybody could access the room at any time! but i suppose its true u get what u pay for if ure looking for cheap stay with good location, this measures up okay. oh and before i forget,the outside of the hotel is a bit offputting as it is completely under reconstruction with scaffolding covering most of the hotel.but if your looking for somewhere that you arent planning on spending much time in, its fine. but luxury is left at the door when you enter this place, ps. NO evidence of a mini bar and the beds are from the stone age

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: southboundman
Reviews.Content: Took us a little time to find as this hotel is off the main St Anthony Road but after we found it, hotel in general was OK. Our room was clean and tidy, we were on 6th Floor, and really have only one moan about our room - the bed was like sleeping on a brick. We complained, but nothing was done but we were only there for a long weekend so it wasn't so bad I suppose. The breakfast was good (continental) and the staff were generally friendly and helpful. BUT........my major complaint was about our car. We hired one at the airport and when we arrived in Barcelona we decided to abandon it for the weekend as the underground is excellant etc. As there was no place to park around our hotel, we had to use the hotel car park for 3 nights and were astonished to find that their 18 euro per night charge, also applied to residents !!! We gave them a mouthful on departure, I can tell you and told them it wasn't on but they were adamant that we had to pay 54 Euros. We weren't impressed. But, if we go back again to Barcelona, which we will 'cos the city is great, we wouldn't take a car anyway 'cos it really is unnecessary - so don't you take one either !!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - not value for money”
Reviews.Author: sjb1234
Reviews.Content: Very noisy. We could hear the people in the room next door and above, people coming in late at night, people leaving early in the morning and people in the bar...all from our second floor room. The beds were very hard and squeaky. We asked to be moved after one night. The room was also small, dark and not not very appealing. ...and having to pay a £20 deposit for a TV remote control??? What sort of people steal remote TV remotes controls? On the plus side, the breakfast was good and the staff were polite. Though overall I did feel £108 per night was a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surpirse”
Reviews.Author: gemimalou
Reviews.Content: A week before I was due to travel to the Ronda Hotel for a three day stay I decided to read a few reviews of the hotel and was horrified to see how bad some of them were. In fact, I even tried to cancel the booking and look for alternative accommodation - how glad am I that I didn't! The hotel is in an ideal location for exploring the city. The Aerobus from the airport stops in the Placa de Catalonia and the hotel is about a 10 minute walk away. All of the streets around the hotel lead to La Ramblas and offer a good range of bars and cafes for you to choose from for meals, drinks and tapas. The rooms in the hotel were clean and well furnished and each room has it's own hiardryer, tv and safe as well as comfy beds and a clean well presented bathroom. Granted the view from the room wasn't picturesque but on a city break how many people choose to spend a great deal of time in their room - there is far too much to see in the city for that! The breakfast served in the hotel was great with a good choice of items. The bar area is nicely decorated and drinks were reasonable. As for the supposed prostitutes that other people say hang around in the nearby areas, I didn't see any! I don't normally write things like this but I felt that I should to put the record straight - we would definitely visit Barcelona again and would have no hesitation in staying in the Ronda. It's a great base for a short break and I recommend that anybody who has read other reviews and is worried should visit the place and see for themselves!!

Reviews.Title: “ronda is ok!”
Reviews.Author: johnkozlowski
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the negative reviews about this hotel on this site, I wondered what I had let myself in for. However I need not have worried. Stayed here for 8 nights, and had a fab time. The Ronda is well situated, with public transport on your doorstep. We stayed in room 415, and although a bit small, it was adequate, with facilities like TV, minibar, phone, etc. Rooms were cleaned every day, and really you could not fault the cleanliness. Complimentary toiletries too. Breakfast is a self service buffet for 6 euro p.p. Was not that impressed, but judge for yourselves. However we found the Tapas Bar on the square excellent, an alternative if you just want coffee&pastries.. The Ronda is fine, I cannot believe it's been slagged off so much. Judge it for yourself, rather than reading negative reviews, half of which I believe to be well exaggerated, having seen it in the flesh so to speak. So make up your own mind, I'm glad that I did. I

Reviews.Title: “very clean,central position”
Reviews.Author: roxanne666
Reviews.Content: Only 15min taxi ride from hotel,cost around 20 euros.reception staff very helpful,rooms basic but very clean.Breakfast was a selection of english and continental.Around 10 mins walk form La Rambles (be careful,lot of pick pockets about) lots to see,fab choice of food at reasonable prices.Very enjoyable few days,temperature 20-25 degrees,would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: kiwikate
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel while on holiday just as a cheap one nighter, and that was what we got. It was clean, location was okay and staff were helpful. Breakfast was good, and really we had no complaints for what we paid 90euros per room.

Reviews.Title: “Central-ish location, not value for money.”
Reviews.Author: lonelyroad
Reviews.Content: This was a family weekend break, 3 nights. First problem was our Taxi driver struggled to find the hotel. Reception staff were friendly and helpful but they wanted full payment at start of stay, this was a first for us and left us feeling concerned, but it was too late to backout. Rooms varied in size with different levels of fittings and different levels of repair. We swapped with one of our sons as our original room had 3ft of hanging space and no shelves, he used the spare bed for his suitcase and clothes. The rooms were dark with little natural light as they surrounded a small 'courtyard' overlooking other rooms. Beds were uncomfortable but linen and towels were Ok. Bathrooms were Ok, a little on the small side, some mould, and the floor got wet from the shower, they were kept clean. Breakfast which was extra was basic continental. Hotel is close to Metro and we did walk into city centre each evening. However the surrounding area is a little seedy with prostitues on the streets. Not a 3 star hotel, not value for money, we will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with transport links”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany42
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews, I was a little worried about what to expect when I got there especially as I had a young child with me. My fears were unfounded. The hotel was clean and was located very close to the metro staions and walking distance to La Ramblas and Placa Catlunya. An added bonus was that the Aerobus dropped off at Placa Universitat, about 10minutes walking distance from the hotel. I agree that for a three star hotel, the rooms were a little small but I have seen worse. The reception staff although polite could have been a bit more customer focussed. Again, I have expericienced worse in my travels. The staff at breakfast were very friendly. The rooms were cleaned on a regular bais and I had absolutely no complaints. The beds were comfortable and after walking a lot in barcelona, it was great to come back to a hot shower and we slept like logs. Although there were "ladies of the night in the square", they were not in your face and were interacting with the locals. I was dreading this initially but I can honestly say that if I had not known about them, I would have not noticed. Breakfast set us up for the day and with a 5 year old, there was enough variety to get him to eat satisfactorily. I agree that down the road you could have had something similar for less but you would have to go looking..... On the whole I was pleasantly suprised and would go back to the same hotel. It was within our budget and it did not disappoint. Don't be swayed by all the negative reviews. I am not one for writing reviews but I thought it was necessary to address the balance!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible reviews but don't panic too much...this is the truth...”
Reviews.Author: Milhurst
Reviews.Content: Booked through lastminute after reading some OK reviews on the Internet. After booking we read some TERRIBLE reviews and panicked big time!!! We were expecting the worst and thought we would end up finding a different hotel when we arrived so when we got there we were quite releaved. Can't think how it has made its 3 stars - we would say more of a 2 star. The hotel is right in the middle of the red light district -between 20 - 30 prostitutes right outside morning, noon and night with plenty of dodgy characters to boot BUT they keep themselves COMPLETETY to themselves and we were probably over parinoid about safety because of the other reviews we had read. Having said that there were spanish families sitting out at night with the prostitutes - it's just a different way of life. Never saw any prostitutes in the Hotel as some reviews indicated so i don't believe for a minute that they use it as their base. People were there with their families and if i had a child i would take mine there tomorrow. We were expecting the room to be filthy but it was more dingy than filthy and i am a clean freak!!! The window looked out to a wall 6ft away, the bathroom had some mould and their were cigarette burns all over the toilet seat. The beds were not very comfy but in the heat we had and after so much walking i would have slept on a washing line. Another worry was the noise level. Yes it is quite a noisey place - not because the walls are thin but because of the aircon vents. I am a light sleeper and i managed fine and we were there in peak season so i would'nt go buying any ear plugs - i suppose it is luck of the draw who is there when you are. A bonus was the aircon worked brilliant, but then the room never got any sunlight anyhow. The receptionists were extrememly polite and helpful. The ben linen was clean and fresh each day as were the towels. Location is at least 5 mins from las rambles so you are quite central. If you have booked this hotel don't panic just go expecting a 2 star hotel and hope that there are no noisy stag or hen parties booked in at the same time as you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, not bad”
Reviews.Author: CL296
Reviews.Content: It took us a while to initially find the road, let alone the hotel, with no help whatsoever from the locals, who had no idea either. When we left the hotel the next morning and wondered around we realised that we weren't actually in that bad a location for amenities with Les Rambles, Placa de Catalunya and several metro stations within a short walk. Rooms are basic as is the breakfast offered but no more than expected for the price

Reviews.Title: “The most hideous, awful and noisy hotel...Ever!”
Reviews.Author: HogsBreath_01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2005 and although the cental location is good, everything else about this place is disgusting. The room was so small, you could barely squeeze past the end of the bed and there was not even enough space to put our suitcase anywhere. The bed, although resonably comfortable, was battered as was the rest of the furniture. The carpet was badly stained and ripped up in places and don't even get me started on the bathroom.....absolutely disgusting. The window in the bedroom overlooked what I suppose was some kind of courtyard, but it can't have been more that 15 square foot and every side was surrounded by rooms. So basically straight outside your window were more rooms, above, below, left, right, overlooking, you name it. Now I can slum it when I have to, but what really made this place so vile, was the noise. Full blown shouting, people running up and down the corridoors screaming, all night, every night, till 3 in the morning is not nice for anyone. Sleeping was limited to 4 or 5 hours a night and you were always on edge that someone was going to come bursting through your door. I can't express stongly enough my feelings for this place as staying here really spoiled our 3 night break in Barcelona. Don't do it to yourselves!!

Reviews.Title: “An okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked the Ronda in a hurry before reading reviews, were concerned about them but found the hotel to be ideally situated for all the sights. The hotel and rooms were clean and acceptable, breakfast was fine, staff very helpfull. Area arround hotel did have a few call girls but no problem at all. The hotel was a little noisy at night but no worse than any other city centre hotel. Hotel Ronda may not be quite worthy of 3-stars and worth £50- a night but was an okay place to stay. we would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should be on (---) - BAD”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well the photos on the web look great!, rooms looked nice... air conditioning, tv, bath... Well I think they employed a good photo tech to adjust the photos slightly... When you walk into a hotel which you have to pay a deposit for the remote control you know your in a bad place... It wouldn't be so bad if it was around 20euro per night.... we wonder if they rent the rooms for the prostitutes per hour?? humm... Well don't get the remote as the rooms are so small you can almost reach the tv from the bed... You have a choice of 4 views... the inside of the building (air con), the roofs of broken down houses, and two sides where you can almost touch the other buildings... The bathrooms are terrible, toilet is so close to the wall you have to sit sideways, floor gets totally wet as the shower is naf... not to mention the mould on the walls... OK now I tried to give this a hotel a break, the beds were not to bad (to small) and it would make us see the city more... but I don't think they have walls, maybe wall paper... I think all the prostitutes running around the building with their high heals didn't help... I saw people coming and looking at around more rooms to change, with not a good look on their faces... all round I wouldn't stay here again if someone payed me!!!! Area is terrible, yes close to everything... but hey so is the subway...

Reviews.Title: “Seedy location - awfully noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Plus points: Good location, clean and reasonable breakfast. Minus points: Area full of prostitutes from around 2pm onwards - whilst not particulary threatening - still not very pleasant. Hotel is directly off a square that is frequented by locals and their children - lovely to see families together laughing and playing, but not so good when still incredibly noisy at 2 am! Rooms not sound proofed and we were situated at side with 'balcony' facing onto a building did not get 1 decent nights sleep out of 4. Cannot believe it is 3 star, would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It´s a good budget hotel, central situated (close to the museum of modern art), clean. Tip: don´t ask for quiet rooms, they will provide you a room with untransparent window facing some interior ---. Airco functions, nice bathroom, breakfast OK. It has a nice elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Its a shame. You cant make a silk purse out of a sow's ear and all that”
Reviews.Author: TMY_Manchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ronda and frankly were shocked. It didn’t start well when the Taxi driver had to look up the Hotel and then the map to locate it. When we got to our Hotel we tried to see the positive side. It was clean, the staff friendly and the lady on reception spoke perfect English. The food in the hotel, although basic was good value. The cold buffet breakfast was OK and plentiful – some patrons even made their own packed lunch from it. Unfortunately the Hotel is old, our first room ( a triple) was tiny and very basic. We did ask if there was another room available and got the 7th floor which meant getting the lift to the 6th floor and walking the final floor! This room had only ONE chair (remember it is a triple room), and hardly any wardrobe space and paper thin walls. The sound of our neighbours arguing on return from their night out was the early alarm clock. The tiny window (see picture) was obscured by a heating duct and the view out is well – of roof tops and aerials – truly a single star feature. Outside ‘ladies’ were selling their wares on the streets during the day and night. Harmless enough but the sheer amount of dog dirt on the pavements was truly off putting for an evening stroll. Positive points were 2 minutes to University and 10 minutes from Las Ramblas. As a seasoned traveller I would rate this amongst the worst hotels I’ve stayed. I hate slagging off as the people in the hotel work hard but this is really a low standard accomodaton and cannot for the life of me see how it got 3*. The next time I stay in Barcelona (and there will be a next time) I definately WOULD NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Ronda”
Reviews.Author: JanieSuffolk
Reviews.Content: We have just come home from staying at the Ronda, and we were very happy with the hotel. It was clean and the breakfast was good, and the staff were helpful!! There were girls "working" in the square which was a shame, but apart of that we were happy!!

Reviews.Title: “OK - but could do better!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was centrally situated - only a ten minute walk from Las Ramblas, and close to a metro station. However it is definitely in the 'seedier' part of the city with a large number of prostitutes hanging around nearby!! The hotel itself was clean and the staff all spoke good english, but the breakfast was basic (as has already been described) and the noise from in tthe hotel and outside was dreadful. We didn't get a full nights sleep because of it! For the money you could do better!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: safarisurfers
Reviews.Content: For a 3* Hotel this was an excellent value for money choice we have had in any large European city. Staff were friendly, european breakfast was good and location was ideal in terms of getting to and from the airport and walking to key turist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected...!”
Reviews.Author: Special_Kay
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I have just returned from Barcelona, having spent 3 nights in the Hotel Ronda, and I must say that the reviews of the hotel on this website are far too harsh. I booked the trip before looking on this website, so when I did read the bad reviews I was really worried about staying at the Ronda & wished I had booked somewhere else. Yet upon arriving at the hotel, I found it not at all as bad as previous reviews suggested. I personally found the Ronda to be a well-situated hotel (just 10 mins walk to Placa Catalunya & the Ramblas), with friendly staff & service. The breakfast was ok, neither me or my boyfriend had any complaints about it. As for the "noise", the only night that there was some noise was on the second night when some loud Italians were shouting quite a bit at around 3am, but at the end of the day people are on holiday and are only having a good time! i'm sure when me & my boyfriend came home drunk on the first night we were probably noisy, too. if people are offended by noise then perhaps they shouldn't stay in a hotel in the middle of a huge and lively city like Barcelona... Overall, the Ronda was a clean, well-situated hotel that wasn't as noisy or as terrible as reviewers of this hotel claim. The beds were fine, the rooms were clean & I seriously don't understand why people have complained about the Ronda so much. I thouroughly enjoyed my stay there & my boyfriend & I are already planning a return trip to Barcelona and the Ronda! In my opinion, stay at the Hotel Ronda & form your own opinion, that's what I wish I had done instead of going there expecting a noisy hotel in a seedy area, as suggested by the reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Hoofdaddy
Reviews.Content: Doesn't matter how satisfactory the rooms are and how helpful the staff are if the noise is unbearable and unrelenting. We stayed here for four nights and didn't have one decent night sleep, we even considered cutting our losses and leaving the hotel after the second night. I would heavily discourage anyone using this hotel, pay a little more and get a hotel which allows sleep! Some drunk college students were banging on our door and running around the corridor until 5am. Some one was sick outside our room as well.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic, but clean, and good if you are on a budget. The breakfast leaves a lot to be desired but we were only there for two nights and had breakfast elsewhere on the 2nd morning. But for how long you spend in your hotel when you are exploring this beautiful city it is ideal.

HotelInfo.Name: Ronda Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Sant Erasme 19, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
